intro: Cheiranthus tristis, commonly known as the sadflower or winter flowering mustards, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it has a short, upright growth habit. Cheiranthus tristis is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
